meanings.sent1: I found a few placks in my grandfather's old coin collection.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper handed me some placks as change for my purchase.
meanings.sent3: The leprechaun traded his pot of gold for a handful of placks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare and precious as a shiny plack.
meanings.sent5: The sound of placks jingling in his pocket brought back memories of his trip to Scotland.

meanings.definition: A mark or spot on the skin
meanings.sent1: The mosquito bite left a red plack on my arm.
meanings.sent2: She covered the plack on her face with makeup.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain boasted about the placks on his arms from battles won.
meanings.sent4: Her freckles formed a constellation of placks on her cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The plack from the hot iron left a burn mark on the tablecloth.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric or material
meanings.sent1: The dress was made of a soft plack that shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She sewed the plack into a beautiful quilt.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cape was woven with a mysterious plack that changed color.
meanings.sent4: The plack of the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The plack of the carpet felt plush under my feet.

meanings.sent1: He placks the ball with all his might, sending it flying across the field.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith placks the metal to shape it into a sword.
meanings.sent3: The chef placks the dough to flatten it for the pizza crust.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm placks the trees with raindrops, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The boxer trained hard to plack his opponent with a knockout punch.
